column4: you can use openssl to encrypt a tarball with a password .. just not a directory tho.

yes, I currently tar my financial records and encrypt them with openssl.  I was hoping I could encrype a whole working directory.  Maybe instead I could encrypt a partition and then mount it manually?  Is that possible?
sure, you can use something like truecrypt to mount volumes as encrypted filesystems
ok, I will look into truecrypt
